Company Policy - Internship Plan

公司制度－实习生计划

For the purpose of optimizing internal management, we will standardize company’s internship operation procedure, including planning, recruitment, insurance and intern allowance payment.

为了优化内部管理，我们将从实习生计划，招聘，保险以及实习津贴支付几个方面规范操作流程。

1.Intership Plan:

实习生计划：

According to the following cases, each department will be entitled to 1-2 interns depend on business situation:

根据以下情况，每个部门根据业务情况可以申请1－2个实习生名额：

  • Temporary employee leave (maternity leave, long time sick leave, work accident leave, etc)
  • 临时性员工替补（产假，长时间病假，工伤期等）
  • During busy season, help regular employee to support shipment
  • 业务旺季，帮助正式员工支援工作
  • Specific project for identified client
  • 为预见的项目客户
  • Other local specific needs
  • 其他需求

 2.Procedure of application

申请流程：

Please fill in “ Trainee Requisition Form”, pass to HR department for approval.

请填写“德莎实习生申请表”, 交至人力资源部批准。

3.Internship recruitment:

实习生招聘：

We will use the following recruitment for intern requirement of each department:

  •  Internet: http
  •  网络招聘：http
  •  与大学/学院成为合作伙伴
  •  Cooperation with consulting company (CISC…)
  •  与咨询公司成为合作伙伴
  •  Internal employee recommendation
  •  内部员工推荐

4.Internship insurance:

实习生保险

   The company will take charge of accident insurance for trainee in consideration of the possibility of work accident.

   考虑到工伤的可能性，公司将为实习生购买意外伤害保险。

5.Intern allowance payment:

实习生津贴付款：

      As intern not belong to real HC of each department, intern allowance will be reimbursed by financial department via transportation invoices, after monthly approved by HR Department.

    由于实习生不属于每个部门的实际编制，实习生的实习津贴将由人力资源部门每月审核后，以交通发票报销的形式交由财务部门支付。

This Policy is effective from July 1st 2011.

本政策自2011年7月1日起正式执行。

data.policy_name: Criteria – Invitation to Events 邀请客户准则
data.policy_content:
Criteria for dealing with invitations to events in accordance with
                     Corporate Compliance
Inviting a customer to an event (sport, culture, entertainment etc.) will also be desired in future and can
continue to be used as a way of retaining customers. However, this has to take place within a defined
framework in order to avoid touching on risky grey areas.


The basic guidelines that arise from the "Code of conduct gratuities" are to be observed and complied
with.
The following criteria apply equally to both potential customers and to existing customers.
An  invitation  to  such  an  event  must  never  come  shortly  before  an  important  decision  process  or  be
connected with such a process (e.g. concluding or extendinga contract, price discussions etc.)
A customer must not - based on an invitation and thus at 's costs - go to an event alone but
exclusively accompanied by at least one employee.
In  every  case  a  balanced  relationship  between  the  number  of  participating  customer  employees  and
employees must be adhered to.
Taking a maximum of one person as accompaniment is permissible for both sides.
In connection with so-called "season tickets" (e.g. sport)  a customer must not be invited several times
per season; instead the invitation is to be limited toone visit per season.
The  provisions  specified  above  relate  to  a  normal  match  or  event.  Dealing  with  extraordinarily  large
events  (sporting  events:  tickets  for  European  championships  or world  cups/championships  or
similar;cultural events: tickets for festivals or similar; inentertainment: tickets for large festivals or similar)
must be coordinated with the Management Board in advance. In this context, the term "extraordinarily" is
understood to mean  that  the  price  for  an  entrance  ticket for  the  event  involved  is  no  longer  seen  as
reasonable in relation to the normal average salary of  a person at the corresponding hierarchy level -
basically at over 10% of the monthly average salary.
Corresponding visits are to be documented in an orderlymanner, including specific details by both sides
(bookkeeping, customer file) in a suitable form.
The criteria specified above also apply to so-called "sponsorship" and tickets possibly acquired through
such  a  connection.  Regardless  of  this  the  following  applies:  irrespective  of  its  specific  character,  if  a
sponsorship  measure  exceeds  €  10,000.00  per  branch,  it  must  be  reported  in  advance  to  the
Management Board for release as a basic principle. Dueto the corresponding budget relevance annual
continuations or extensions of existing sponsorship agreements are to be reported (e.g. as part of the
annual appraisal meeting). Relevant national taxation law provisions - if available - are to be observed
and complied with.
